definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: My T-shirt is dirty after the ball game.
sentences.chinese: 球赛后，我的运动杉很脏。

sentences.english: The ball game was postponed because of rain.
In the basketball match he can block.
Are you going to the tailgate party this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 你今天下午要去足球赛前的聚会吗？

sentences.english: He refereed a basketball game yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天为一场篮球赛作裁判。

sentences.english: They called off the football match because of a severe thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 因为暴雨太大了，他们把橄榄球赛取消了。

sentences.english: Basketball fans miss Magic Johnson 's razzle dazzle in the game.
sentences.chinese: 篮球迷们怀念魔术师强纳生球赛中的花招。

sentences.english: Have a good rest, you need to save your energy for the tennis match this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 好好休息，你要为下午的网球赛节省点精力。

sentences.english: Stoudemire might be playing his final games for Phoenix.
sentences.chinese: 这有可能是小斯代表太阳打的最有一个系列的球赛。

sentences.english: As soon as the gates were opened, crowds of football supporters piled in.
sentences.chinese: 门一打开，成群的为足球赛呐喊助威的人涌了进来。

sentences.english: I'd strap him to my chest and go to a ball game.
sentences.chinese: 我把他绑在我的胸前，一起去看棒球赛。

sentences.english: The football match (being) over， crowds of people poured out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛五结束，从群便涌到大街上。

sentences.english: I've missed more than nine thousand shots in my career. I've lost almost three hundred games.
sentences.chinese: 我投失了九千多个球，输了几乎三百场球赛。

sentences.english: Did you watch the football game in Wutaishan stadium last night ?
sentences.chinese: 你昨晚去五台山体育馆看足球赛了吗？

sentences.english: I like to watch tennis matches.
At last I found it exciting to watch games with him.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我发现同他一起看球赛真令人兴奋。

definition: to watch a football game (or other ball game)/Fore! (golf)/Watch out for the ball!
open ball (math.)/to start a ball game/to kick off (soccer)/to tee off (golf)
football played with oval-shaped ball (rugby, American football, Australian rules etc)
table tennis/table tennis ball (Tw)/billiards/pool/snooker (HK, Singapore, Malaysia)
(ball game) enthusiast (player)/golf buddy (or tennis buddy etc)
